Modifiers

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe the role of modifiers in policy ratings

¢ Describe the different types of modifiers

« Work with different modifiers within
PolicyCenter

Dalia

t \

| need to apply a factor or a list of factors
to adjust the premium that the rating
engine calculates.

| Rate modifier Gi

¢ Isa value that the rating engine uses
POY to justify the policy premium, or some
QO portion of the policy premium
* Captures information relevant to
(4/7 = pricing that are not necessarily tied to
specific coverage or coverables

Gi

¢ Affects the rating of coverages

* Creates an instance of a modifier
that affects the cost of a policy

| Demonstration G
Creating basic modifiers

Use them for factors such as management, property, and other intangibles that you

| RateFactor typelist Gi

ffi) RateFactorType.ttx x
im typecode & | (SZshow al

Rate factors must be listed in the RateFactorType typelist before they can be added
to a schedule rate in Product Designer

Question

,- — For the Personal Auto policy line, why are there two possible values for a
¢ modifier’s "modifier type"?

¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Gi

Answer Gi

,- — For the Personal Auto policy line, why are there two possible values for a
x modifier’s "modifier type"?
¢

In Personal Auto, a modifier can be associated with the policy line or to a specific
vehicle. When creating the modifier, you specify a modifier type to denote if it is policy
line level (PAModifier) or vehicle level (PAVehicleModifier).

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

,~ — When do you need to add values to the RateFactorType typelist?

4
¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

7
¢
¢
¢

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

When do you need to add values to the RateFactorType typelist?

You need to add typecodes to the RateFactorType typelist when you create a
schedule rate modifier and the desired rate factors don't already exist.
